Package edu.bu.labs.rttt.game

Class RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView

java.lang.Object
edu.bu.labs.rttt.game.RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView
Enclosing class:
RecursiveTicTacToeGame
public static class RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView extends Object
A class that represents a read-only immutable view into the state of the recursive tic tac toe game.
See Also:
  • Coordinate

      public Coordinate getCurrentGameCoord()

    • getGameView

      public TicTacToeGame.TicTacToeGameView getGameView(int rIdx, int cIdx)
      A getter method to get the TicTacToeGame.TicTacToeGameView of an "inner" game specified by row/col indices.
      Parameters:
      rIdx - The row (y coordinate) index of the "inner" game to get its state.
      cIdx - The col (x coordinate) index of the "inner" game to get its state.
      Returns:
      The TicTacToeGame.TicTacToeGameView at the desired indices.

      A getter method to get the TicTacToeGame.TicTacToeGameView of an "inner" game specified by a Coordinate.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordinate of the "inner" game to get the state of.
      Returns:
      The TicTacToeGame.TicTacToeGameView at the desired Coordinate.

    • getOutcome

      public PlayerType getOutcome(int rIdx, int cIdx)
      A getter method to get the outcome value of an "inner" game specified by row/col indices. An outcome will be a PlayerType if that "inner" game has been won by that player, otherwise null. This value is cached the same turn an "inner" game is won.
      Parameters:
      rIdx - The row (y coordinate) index of the "inner" game to lookup the outcome of.
      cIdx - The col (x coordinate) index of the "inner" game to lookup the outcome of.
      Returns:
      The outcome PlayerType of an "inner" game. Will be null if no winner.

    • getOutcome

      public PlayerType getOutcome(Coordinate c)
      A getter method to get the outcome value of an "inner" game specified by a Coordinate. An outcome will be a PlayerType if that "inner" game has been won by that player, otherwise null. This value is cached the same turn an "inner" game is won.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordinate of the "inner" game to lookup the outcome of.
      Returns:
      The outcome PlayerType of an "inner" game. Will be null if no winner.

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds(Coordinate c)
      A method to determine if the provided Coordinate is in-bounds (e.g. the location is valid). The x coordinate corresponds to a column index and the y coordinate corresponds to a row index.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordinate to test if it is in bounds or not.
      Returns:
      true if the Coordinate's x coordinate is within [0, num_cols) and its y coordinate is within [0, num_rows) and false otherwise.

    • isLegalMove

      public boolean isLegalMove(Coordinate gameCoord, Coordinate moveCoord)
      A method to determine if the square specified by moveCoord is available within an "inner" game located at gameCoord. A square on a TicTacToeGame.TicTacToeGameView is considered available if it is not occupied and if it is not marked as unavailable ( see CellType).
      Parameters:
      gameCoord - The location of the "inner" game.
      moveCoord - The location on the "inner" game to check for availability.
      Returns:
      true if that square is available and false otherwise.

    • didPlayerWin

      public boolean didPlayerWin(PlayerType type)
      A method to determine if the specified PlayerType has won the recursive tic tac toe game. Someone wins the game if they have won a tic tac toe game where the squares of this game are won by winning the corresponding "inner" games at those locations. In this implementation, the outcomes of "inner" games are stored in a separate 2d array mirroring the 2d array of "inner" games. When an "inner" game ends, the outcome is stored in the 2d array of outcomes at the corresponding position. A player wins if they win tic tac toe on the outcome 2d array.
      Parameters:
      type - The PlayerType to check if that player won or not.
      Returns:
      true if the specified player has won the recursive tic tac toe game by making tic tac toe of outcomes.

    • canAnyMoveBeMade

      public boolean canAnyMoveBeMade()
      This is an interesting edge-case of this game. Since when a player marks a square on an "inner" game, the location that mark is made determines which "inner" game their opponent makes their move on next. When an "inner" game is won, the remaining empty squares can still be used, only the winner of that "inner" game can no longer change. Additionally, when an "inner" game is completely full (e.g. there are no remaining empty squares on that "inner" game), any empty squares on *other* "inner" game that would lead to the filled "inner" game are marked as UNAVAILABLE and can no longer be chosen. This can lead to states where an opponent has no legal moves they can make yet there are empty squares somewhere on the game. This method detects for this edge case and is used in determining if a game is over or can continue.
      Returns:
      true if any move can be played and false otherwise.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      A method to determine if the game is over. A game is over if either player wins the game, if there are no more legal moves left to play, or the maximum number of turns is met (yes I realize that this case is covered by the "there are no more legal moves to make" case but I check for it anyways just in case).
      Returns:
      true if no-one has won and there are still legal moves to be made and false otherwise.

    • getOutcome

      public PlayerType getOutcome()
      A method to get the outcome of a game. If a player won, that player's PlayerType is returned. If the game ended in a tie then null is returned.
      Returns:
      The PlayerType if that player won the game or null for a tie.

    • getAvailableMoves

      public Set<Coordinate> getAvailableMoves()
      A method to get all available Coordinates that the current player could choose on the current "inner" game. This method cannot be called on the first turn of the game when there is no "inner" game already chosen. If this method is called on the first turn it will return null.
      Returns:
      The set of Coordinates the current player can make on the current "inner" game and null if the current "inner" game is not set (like on the first turn).

    • getAvailableFirstMoves

      public Map<Coordinate,Set<Coordinate>> getAvailableFirstMoves()
      A method to get all available moves that can be made on the first turn of the game. On the first turn of the game, not only is a coordinate on an "inner" game chosen, but the Coordinate *of* the "inner" game is also chosen. This method returns a map of choices. The key is the coordinate *of* each "inner" game, and the value is a set of Coordinates that the player could choose on that specific "inner" game. This should only be called on the first turn of the game.
      Returns:
      The map of choices. The key is the coordinate *of* each "inner" game, and the value is a set of Coordinates that the player could choose on that specific "inner" game.

    • applyMove

      public RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView applyMove(Coordinate moveCoord)
      A method to apply the provided move (e.g. the Coordinate the current player wants to mark) on the current "inner" game. This method should not be called unless the current "inner" game has been set (so be careful if you choose to call this on the first turn of the game).
      Parameters:
      moveCoord - The Coordinate of the square the current player wants to mark on the current "inner" game.
      Returns:
      A RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView where the move has been made and game logic advanced one turn.

    • applyFirstMove

      public RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView applyFirstMove(Coordinate gameCoord, Coordinate moveCoord)
      A method to apply the provided move (e.g. the Coordinate the current player wants to mark) on the "inner" game located at the other provided Coordinate. This should only be called on the first turn of the game.
      Parameters:
      gameCoord - The location of the "inner" game to make the move on.
      moveCoord - The location of the square on the specified "inner" game to mark.
      Returns:
      A RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView where the move has been made and game logic advanced one turn.
